page.title: 20HISTORY OF GOSFORTH, CUMBRIA
page.content: Gosforth has a long history, although there are few records, other than odd documents held at St. Bees Monastery. The presence of the Runic crosses in the churchyard and the hog's back tomb show that a group of people must have lived here in the 900's.The church was sadly improved in the 1870's, and little remains to show its long history. Gosforth Hall is now a hotel, but the inscription,"R.& I.C." dated 1673 can still be seen over the fireplace,& a door heading in the barn is inscribed 1658. The library used to be someone's house bearing, over the doorway, the names John & Margret Sherwen, and the date 1628. Park Nook is mentioned in writing in 1575,& many farm houses have histories
